title: FTSE LIVE: Jet2 soaks up Thomas Cook customers; Pound lifts on hopes for a Brexit deal
text:
The US-China trade talks are very much in focus today, along with the newly raised hopes of a Brexit deal which sent the pound back above $1.24.

Jet2.com is experiencing higher demand since the collapse of Thomas Cook, its owner Dart Group said today, and has lifted its profit guidance for the year as a result.

The group does, however, remain cautious about the numerous sector headwinds, including Brexit uncertainty, fluctuating oil prices and a weak pound.

Meanwhile, Peppa Pig owner Entertainment One has reported widening losses ahead of the completion of its £3.3billion sale to toy giant Hasbro.
description: In the markets, the US-China trade talks are very much in focus today, along with the newly raised hopes of a Brexit deal which gave the pound a lift on Thursday afternoon.
authors: Emily Hardy For This Is Money
